item.title: Fiber Optic Communications Without The Fiber
item.description: There’s a common understanding that our capacity for using twisted pair copper for bandwidth is reaching its limit. We’re even facing a serious shortage of wireless bandwidth. The Federal Communications Commission is searching for underused frequencies to allocate for wireless broadband. However, the idea that technology might stall due to depleted spectral resources is misguided if we consider an innovative solution. Radio frequencies are a finite resource. Lower frequencies are less useful due to their limited capacity for carrying information.
